turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: What is it??

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Something with the power, I don't know!!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: I...don't think...anybody should be touching the body.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I think I'll do what I damn well please.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- the window and door grates --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- no -- that's when everything went ragtime -- whoever else is in this house has been doing everything since -- I thought it was Evelyn --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I was upstairs!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: I never saw you --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: If you've got a gun on you, Price, I'd hand it over now.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Not just yet. Would any of you be interested in knowing exactly why I ended up here in the basement?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Fascinated.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I was chasing after somebody I saw in the salon.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Well, I don't.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Then just wait -- maybe this whoever's got you next on the Asylum's equipment- test list. Maybe a literal mind-blow inside the "Saturation Chamber."

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: I'll take my chances.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Well, I can't, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Don't test me, I'm real prepared to use this to stay alive --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- confirming everything we already know --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- I'll take the chance, come morning and cops, I'll be proved right --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- listen to me, goddamnit --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- no more --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Then tell me, please -- help me...!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Don't think so. Stay the fuck back.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Please! I need your help.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Not even for a million dollars, Mr. Price.

turns.speaker: SCHECTER
turns.text: Houston, I think we may have a problem.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Evelyn, go stir your cauldron or something for a sec.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Problem where? Looked good to me.

turns.speaker: SCHECTER
turns.text: "Dummy 6" keeps losing his arm.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: So disengage his Flail Arm Mechanism and just make him a screamer.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- hey! Next time give me a couple seconds notice before you wing a gag like that!

turns.speaker: SCHECTER
turns.text: The lockdown thing.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I mean, not that it didn't give Evelyn the kind of coronary I had in mind, just...

turns.speaker: SCHECTER
turns.text: -- it wasn't me.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Rewind that.

turns.speaker: SCHECTER
turns.text: I was just sitting here -- it happened. I had nothing to do with it.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Then who did??

turns.speaker: SCHECTER
turns.text: No idea. I didn't even know the damn thing still worked!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: It works.

turns.speaker: SCHECTER
turns.text: Maybe it was just its time to finally fall apart.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: No. Somehow -- I don't know how -- she did it.

turns.speaker: SCHECTER
turns.text: Pretty amazing feat: all that shit down the basement and your wife's up in the bedroom the whole time.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Don't take your eyes off her for a second. I think she just declared War.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: But the million bucks each, that's for real?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: It better be -- he still owes me $25 grand for renting the place for the night! Here, let's get you some illumination so you can make your way safely!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Wish I could take the credit, but --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- guess we know where Mr. Price is now.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: He must've beaten us all here!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Of course he did, for God's sake.  Didn't he, Mr. Pritchett?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I can't comment until I get paid.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Oh, no.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Don't know that it does.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Well, then, how 'bout maybe we call someone?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Hasn't been a telephone in this House in over 60 years.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Won't do any good.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Uh, excuse me? Don't think I'm not having the time of my life watching this train wreck that's your marriage -- but this isn't what I had in mind... I want to know that we can get out of here if we need to.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Believe me, we need to.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Pritchett, this "lockdown" thing -- it's gotta have like a master control -- you know machinery, gears, whatever -- somewhere in this place?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: The basement -- but, believe me, you don't want to go down there.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: No, you don't want to go down there. I am going down there. And I'm going to find reverse on this thing and floor it.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: You'll never find it, it's a maze down there.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Well, that leaves you with two options then, doesn't it: either show me where and maybe we get out of here -- or it's spend-the-night-sleep-tight.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: You should really open this place to the public, Pritchett -- a spa for people without enough stress in their lives.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I said we shouldn't come down here. Very treacherous -- physical and metaphysical levels, both. There've been no refurbishments to this part of the house -- it's exactly as it was in 1931.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Ghosts killed your father?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Not ghosts... at least not what you're thinking... Vannacutt used to dump the bodies of his failed experiments somewhere in the house...

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: And you think it's in there?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Accumulated evil... festering for decades...  But I'm a drunk... so don't listen to me.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: There is something very not normal going on here!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: This? This is nothing. You've only been dealing with the House itself. You have no idea what you're tinkering with. Sooner or later, the darkness that is at the core will get out... One of you will release it... Not meaning to, of course... then...  ...Bye, bye, Miss American Pie...

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Pritchett, what is this "core of darkness"?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I thought you understood.... It's the souls of Vannacutt's dead... The insanity... The horror... Victims burned alive... All that pain percolating somewhere in the house for seventy-some years...  ...singing this will be the day that I die... This will be the day that I....

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: You coming, or are you waiting for Blackburn?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Blackburn's dead.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: He would have been back by now.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Price!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Oh, dear.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Pritchett: what is going on?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: He must've unsealed the room!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: How, he's supposed to be dead!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: -- ten.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- Eddie!!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Over here.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Please.....anyone....help me?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Melissa...?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: For the love of God....please...?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Melissa, it's Sara -- is that you?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Sara...?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Keep talking, I'll find you!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Something....happened --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- I'm coming --

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: -- something horrible...I don't understand --

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: I feel something.  It's faint, but...it's there...

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You say you saw some activity here?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Damn it.

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: These records only go back to 1880. But...  ...wait a minute...

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: Did you find something?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I did a cross search, death certificates with this address. James and Marion Foster.  They had a daughter.  Right here, it says James died, 1882, pneumonia. Marion dies September the next year. Suicide.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: It doesn't say.  But that's not what interests me.  There's no death certificate for the daughter.  Anywhere.

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: What was her name?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Colleen.

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: So many unanswered questions.  Why was she buried there.  And who killed her?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: It might have been her mother.

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: We don't have proof of that.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: The style of dress on the girl... it coincides with the era Marion Foster killed herself.  Who else could have gone in there and done something like that?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: They don't build them like this anymore.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Suppose not.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Town records are coming up now.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What will they tell you?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I'll be able to do a search, to find out who lived here previously.  And who died here.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I have to admit you really have a beautiful home.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Thank you.  If you told me two years ago we'd be living here, I would never have believed it.  Do you live around here?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: No, I live about in Wexford.  It's about a five hour drive.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How did you meet Dr. Shea?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: There were a series of lectures about parapsychology at my university.  I went and heard him speak, and became fascinated with the idea of hunting ghosts.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I have to admit I was skeptical.  Until now.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: So was I.  The usual investigation turns up nothing more times than not.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Well, I guess this whole thing was as strange for you as it was for us.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Yes.  It was.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: It looks delicious...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Why don't you pass me your plate?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Did you find her?!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: A few years older, perhaps.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How's your arm?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: It will heal.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: There's no need to be.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Good-bye.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Good-bye.

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: May you find the peace you've sought in vain for so long.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: That poor little girl.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Where does this amulet come from?

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: It's origin is unknown.  The symbol does correspond  to a dagger I acquired many years ago.

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: The dagger is used to free those possessed if stabbed directly into the heart, according to ancient beliefs -

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: By killing them?

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: By freeing them.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: The knife destroys the evil and saves the soul of the possessed.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What do these ingredients mean?

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: Pearl, is the twilight, the divinity... Onyx is the sickle, death...

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Can we leave out a bowl of milk, mommy?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Mommy, the leprechauns drank the milk last night.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Well I bet you they're happy.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Can I do it again tonight?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: We'll have every leprechaun in Ireland here honey.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Don't play games with me, little girl.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: I didn't do anything, mommy.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Well then who did?!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Maybe it was Colleen...

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Who...is Colleen?

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: It's going to hurt us!

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: No it won't - no it won't!

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Honey, isn't your friend's name Colleen?

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Can you talk to her?

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: She talks to me.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: She's down...

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: She's down...how do you mean honey?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Aubrey, come on down and have some dinner!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Ok...

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: My angel!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: I'm scared!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Are we leaving mommy?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Yes, we'll be leaving soon.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Where are we going to go, mommy?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: We're going to go someplace new.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: What about all my other stuff?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: We'll get it later.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: H-how long will it take?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Go to your room!  Now!

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Your father doesn't love us anymore!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: What do you mean?  Mommy? You're scaring me!

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Oh my God, what happened to you? My baby -

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: I'm ok mommy.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: She says she's lonely...

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: She's here.

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: Where is she now?

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: She's hiding.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: She's down.  Help her...

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: Take me to her.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Help me!  Please!!!

turns.speaker: SHEA
turns.text: My God, I heard something!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Can I have this room daddy?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Sure.  Did you see the others?

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: I want this one, daddy.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Ok.  If you want this room, you can have it.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: What's he doing daddy?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: He's blessing the house.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: For good luck honey.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Did you grow up in Ireland mister?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: That's father, Aubrey. SEAMUS Well yes I did.  Lived here my whole life.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Did you ever see a leprechaun?

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Look daddy!  It's empty!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: That's great, honey.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We're here Aubrey!  Look, don't be afraid.  We want you to come back to us...

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: It's dark!  I can't breathe!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: I can't move!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Fight it back Aubrey.  Fight it back as hard as you can!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Mommy please help me!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Don't be afraid!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Daddy, please!!!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Oh my God!  She's in there!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Daddy help!

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Are we going back to California daddy?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Well, that all depends.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Good night Angel...

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Good night daddy.

turns.speaker: AUBREY
turns.text: Mommy!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Aubrey run! Aubrey stares in horror at Maura - just then the knife FADES AWAY as Maura rolls over, returned to normal -

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: I could use a little help. We have to return the van soon.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Ok ok...we're just gonna head inside here...

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Now remember we have to call someone about that replacing that water heater.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yeah I'll look into that tonight.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: I hope we have more success than we did with the cleaning service.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The place is pretty dusty.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Well the realtor said that was going to be taken care of and it wasn't.  I'll have to call her.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Who knows...  we have to get used to living around here.  Maybe good help is hard to find.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Must be...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Will, maybe we should have separate bedrooms for a while.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Oh come on...

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: I just, I don't know...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What will Aubrey think?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Aubrey knows more about us than you think.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Well maybe we don't need to remind her of it.  She has a lot more to adjust to...new friends, new schools...it would be good if she had a stable family environment.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: You didn't think much about that before.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Look, I thought we were all right on this, Maura.  It's over.  You know that.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: It's just going to take a while.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Whatever you say.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: To our family.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: To our family.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: I wish I knew more about her.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Did anyone in your family keep in touch with her?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Not really.  She was just one of those names you hear growing up. You know, so-and-so who lives in Ireland.  I really don't think anyone knew about this place.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Or what she was worth.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: God rest her soul.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: I don't think she willed it to me out of sentiment.  She didn't even know who I was.  It's just... tradition.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Are you playing tricks on me?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: It's not going to work.  I'm too smart for you.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I don't know.  That's strange.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No.  Maybe it was Aubrey.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: She's asleep.  I think that's what I need, too. I'm starting to see things.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yeah, well I'll be joining you shortly.  I just want to...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: ...set up some more things.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Ok.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The heater's here.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Were you fooling with the power?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Didn't you just see the power go off and on?  I just had a bulb break on me!

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It was in the cellar.  Weird.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Well something just happened to the power upstairs... Maura heads off and shakes her head, troubled by the event -

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Weird sounds, things moving, lights going off.  The videotape...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: So what are you saying?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: I don't know what I'm saying.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: But do you agree with me?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yeah, I'd say some weird things have happened.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Well what do you think it is?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Well, I try to keep an open mind, but...

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Maybe Eliza wasn't so crazy after all.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: There's got to be an explanation. It could be a magnetic flux or something, maybe the power lines are giving off something.  Who knows?  I don't know, I think it's kind of interesting.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Well what power lines, Will?  Where?  Maybe we should call someone about it.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: I don't know.  Someone who...knows about this kind of stuff.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Oh come on!

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: What about keeping an open mind?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Just because I have an open mind doesn't mean I'm going to pay some snake oil peddler to come in and shake a voodoo stick around the house.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Voodoo stick?  It's nothing like that Will.  You're just being cynical.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'm being realistic.  Look, I have a spiritual side.  I mean, we had a priest come in and bless the house.  That should count for something.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It just disappeared.  Literally.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: I'm sure this sounds crazy to you.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Whoa there...

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Are you ok?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: She has a...friend.  Colleen.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: A friend?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: You, an imaginary friend.  That's what she calls her.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: How are we doing?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I think everything's ready.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Good.  I'll start bringing things in.

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Oh my God where is she!

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: She's gone!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Aubrey?!  Aubrey?!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Aubrey!

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: Aubrey!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It doesn't matter to me.  What do you mean by that?

turns.speaker: MAURA
turns.text: You seem to appreciate the local scenery.
